<!-- SiteCatalyst code version: H.20.3.

    http://www.omniture.com -->


    <script type="text/javascript">
      var searchTerms = '';
    </script>

    
    
    

    <script type="text/javascript">


    var refererHost = "direct";

    if (document.referrer) {
        var docReferrerHostMatches = new RegExp("://([^/]*)/.*").exec(document.referrer);
        /* Check just to be safe */
        if (docReferrerHostMatches) {
            var docReferrerHost = docReferrerHostMatches[1];
            refererHost = docReferrerHost;
        }
    }


    // login tracking (1)
    DM.pageEvents.listen(DM.pageEvents.PAGE_LOGIN_BUTTON_CLICKED, function (obj, event, pars){
        if (pars.action === 'loggingIn'){
            document.cookie = "attempting_login=true; path=/";
        }
    });

    var pagemeta = {
        environment: 'production',
        clientSegmentation: {"segments":{"a":{"weight":10},"b":{"weight":10},"c":{"weight":80}},"shuffleNumber":2,"defaultSegment":"default"},
        comscoreClientId: '14366613',
        comscoreNsSite: 'master',
        domain: 'dailymail.co.uk',
        channel: '/home',
        channelId: '1',
        subChannel: '/home',
        subChannel2: '',
        contentType: 'home',
        articleTitle: '',
        articleId: '',
        articleVersionNumber: '',
        internalSearchTerms: searchTerms,
        loggedInStatus: (DM.isLoggedIn ? 'Logged In' : 'Logged Out'),
        galleryTitle: '',
        galleryId: '',
        threadTitle: '',
        threadId: '',
        userId: DM.userId,
        partnerSite:  '',
        publishedDate: null,
        updatedDate: null,
        authorName: '',
        authorsIds: [],
        authorsShortNames: [],
        errorUrl: '',
        serverDate: new Date(1588793340022),
        url: 'D=g',
        referringSubDomain: refererHost,
        topics: [],
        inlineLinks: '',
        pageName: '/home/home',
        products: '',
        
        
        bundleLocation: 'https://www.dailymail.co.uk/static/gunther/17.12.3',
        bundleVersion: '17.12.3',
        syncBundleLocation: 'https://www.dailymail.co.uk/static/mol-fe/static/mol-fe-sync-bundle/4.8.2',
        syncBundleVersion: '4.8.2',
        asyncBundleLocation: 'https://www.dailymail.co.uk/static/mol-fe/static/mol-fe-async-bundle//6.13.4',
        asyncBundleVersion: '6.13.4',
        videoBundleLocation: 'https://www.dailymail.co.uk/static/videoplayer/6.4.0',
        videoBundleVersion: '6.4.0',
        adsBundleLocation: 'https://www.dailymail.co.uk/static/mol-adverts/4.0.73',
        adsBundleVersion: '4.0.73',
        feTag: 'fe_desktop_default',
        
        
        appVersion: '5.278.0',
        configVersion: '742',
        textBased: false,
        isDecorator: '' === 'true',
        isFeatureArticle: '' === 'true',
        webPush: {"baseEndpoint":"https://www.dailymail.co.uk/api/web-push-notification/","hostname":"dailymail.co.uk","promptFrequency":"5m","promptEnabled":true},
        renderPlatform: 'desktop'     };
    // login tracking (1)

    if (document.cookie.replace(/(?:(?:^|.*;\s*)attempting_login\s*\=\s*([^;]*).*$)|^.*$/, "$1") === "true" &&
        DM.isLoggedIn) {
            document.cookie = "attempting_login=false; path=/";
            pagemeta.registrationEntry = 'Successfully Logged In';
    }

    DM.setPageMetadata(pagemeta);

    /************* DO NOT ALTER ANYTHING BELOW THIS LINE ! **************/
    DM.pageEvents.fireEvent(DM.pageEvents.PAGE_RENDER_STARTED, DM.getPageMetadata());
    </script>


    <script type="text/javascript">
    if(navigator.appVersion.indexOf('MSIE')>=0)document.write(unescape('%3C')+'\!-'+'-')
    </script>

    window.molMVTest = (window.molMVTest ? window.molMVTest + ',' : '') + pagemeta.feTag;
    </script>

        <ul data-login-comp class="float-r">
          <li class="first">

              Login
            </a>
          </li>

<div class="h1-page-last-updated">
    <span class="home">
        <span class="xocc">&nbsp;</span>
    </span>
    
    <h1>Home</h1>
    <span>Last updated: 20:17 BST, 6 May 2020</span>
</div>

<!--class fe.views.body_modules.ContentDivRenderer-->
<div id="content"><!--class fe.channel.billboard.Billboard-->
<div class="billboard_wrapper billboard-watermark relative"><!-- ad: https://mads.dailymail.co.uk/v5/ng/home/none/channel/other/billboard.html --><div class="adHolder billboard" id="billBoard"><script>adverts.addToArray({"pos":"billboard","dcopt":true})</script><span class="mol-ads-label-container"><span class="mol-ads-label">Advertisement</span></span></div>
<div class="billboard-show js-show hdn"><a class="homeblue" href="#"><b class="arrow-small-d"></b> show ad</a></div></div>
<!--class fe.views.body_modules.ContentRenderer-->
<div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ItemList" itemprop="mainEntity">
    <div class="gamma">
        <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-tri-headline">
  <meta itemprop="position" content="1" />
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a itemprop="url" href="/news/article-8292573/Boris-Johnson-admits-UKs-coronavirus-death-toll-appalling.html" >Lockdown will be eased on MONDAY: Government will drop 'stay at home' message this weekend when PM eases restrictions as Matt Hancock says cafes with 'outdoor facilities' could REOPEN and pubs gear up to let drinkers order rounds from beer gardens </a>
  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">
      <a href="/news/article-8292573/Boris-Johnson-admits-UKs-coronavirus-death-toll-appalling.html">
          <img 
               src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/16/article-8292573-28077372-344_964x542.jpg"
               height="542" width="964" alt="Coronavirus UK: Lockdown may ease in outdoor cafes on MONDAY" 
               style="max-width:100%" />
      
        <noscript>
      
          <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/16/article-8292573-28077372-344_964x542.jpg" height="542" width="964" alt="Coronavirus UK: Lockdown may ease in outdoor cafes on MONDAY" />
      
        </noscript>
    </a>
    <div >
      <p>
        
        Boris Johnson today announced he is hoping to begin easing the UK's coronavirus lockdown on Monday as Matt Hancock suggested cafes could reopen if they have outdoor drinking areas. The Prime Minister said some measures will be lifted from the start of next week if the latest scientific evidence shows the spread of the disease is sufficiently under control. The PM will renew social distancing restrictions on Thursday before using an address to the nation on Sunday night to set out his lockdown exit strategy. He is pushing ahead despite today admitting that the UK's death toll, which is closing in on 30,000 and is the worst in Europe, is 'appalling'. Mr Johnson said the Sunday address would prepare people for potential changes on Monday but the specifics remain a secret. However, Health Secretary Matt Hancock gave a hint as to what could be expected as he suggested cafes with outdoor seating could be allowed to reopen in certain circumstances. He told Sky News: 'There is strong evidence that outdoors the spread is much, much lower, so there may be workarounds that some businesses, for instance cafes, especially over the summer, may be able to put into place.' Meanwhile, Public Health England is said to have told councils across the country to prepare this weekend to shift away from the government's current 'stay home' message to a new slogan.
      </p>
    </div>
  </div>
  <div class="article-icon-links-container"
     data-followbutton="MailOnline"
      data-social-first-article-links>

          <div class="alpha">
                <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-tri-headline exclusive">
    <meta itemprop="position" content="2" />
    <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
        <a itemprop="url" href="/news/article-8294009/Neil-Fergusons-MOTHER-LAW-comes-defence-saying-believe-vilified.html" >'He's working his socks off and this is how he is repaid?' Professor Lockdown's MOTHER-IN-LAW comes to his defence and says she cannot believe he is being vilified 'because he invited a woman into his flat' </a>
    </h2>
    <div class="articletext">
        <a href="/news/article-8294009/Neil-Fergusons-MOTHER-LAW-comes-defence-saying-believe-vilified.html">
                <img 
                     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/20/28085980-0-image-m-6_1588792643462.jpg"
                     height="382" width="636" alt="Neil Ferguson's MOTHER-IN-LAW comes to his defence saying she cannot believe he is being" 
                     style="max-width:100%" />
            
              <noscript>
            
                <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/20/28085980-0-image-m-6_1588792643462.jpg" height="382" width="636" alt="Neil Ferguson's MOTHER-IN-LAW comes to his defence saying she cannot believe he is being" />
            
              </noscript>
        </a>
        <div >
        <p>
            
            Eileen Pirie, 79, said the Imperial College scientist (centre) had been working incredibly long hours devoting himself to plotting Britain's path through the coronavirus crisis. And she defended his right to have a woman, Antonia Staats (left, married to Chris Lucas, right), visiting him at his flat in London, saying that he and her daughter are 'no longer close'. Speaking outside her large, detached house in Oxford, Mrs Pirie said: 'I think it is absolutely disgraceful the things that are being said about him. All of this derision because he invited a woman into his flat? Is this really such a big deal. I think we need to get things in perspective.' Mrs Pirie said that Dr Ferguson and his wife Kim, who have a 16 year old son between them, had separated as a couple some years ago but remained supportive of one another as parents. After Professor Ferguson was caught flouting the measures, former Brexit secretary David Davis called for a shake up of the Government's lockdown strategy during the coronavirus which he claimed was based on 'secret and potentially flawed calculations'. Scotland Yard said today that police 'do not intend to take any further action' against Professor Ferguson.
        </p>
    </div>
</div>

  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">

                    <div class="column-split first-column">
                          <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-large cleared" data-original-title="Sweden nears 'horrifying' death toll of 3,000 from coronavirus with 87 new fatalitie">
  <meta itemprop="position" content="6" />
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a itemprop="url" href="/news/article-8293349/Sweden-nears-horrifying-death-toll-3-000-coronavirus-87-new-fatalitie.html" >Sweden nears 'horrifying' death toll of 3,000 from coronavirus with 87 new fatalities, including a child under ten</a>
  </h2>
  <a href="/news/article-8293349/Sweden-nears-horrifying-death-toll-3-000-coronavirus-87-new-fatalitie.html">
        <img 
             src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/18/28082566-0-image-m-23_1588785384112.jpg"
             height="450" width="308" alt="Sweden nears 'horrifying' death toll of 3,000 from coronavirus with 87 new fatalitie" 
             style="max-width:100%" />
    
      <noscript>
    
        <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/18/28082566-0-image-m-23_1588785384112.jpg" height="450" width="308" alt="Sweden nears 'horrifying' death toll of 3,000 from coronavirus with 87 new fatalitie" />
    
      </noscript>
  </a>
  <div class="articletext-holder">
    <p>
      
      'We are starting to near 3,000 deceased, a horrifyingly large number,' state epidemiologist Anders Tegnell told a press conference in Stockholm. The Scandinavian country, which has taken a softer approach to containing the virus, reported another 87 deaths, compared to 85 fatalities the day before. There were another 702 cases, compared to 495 on Tuesday, taking its total to 23,918. Among them, according to Aftonbladet, a child aged under ten who had been in intensive care. Tegnell told the paper it was investigating the death but would not confirm whether it was as a result of COVID-19.
    </p>
    <div class="article-icon-links-container"
     data-followbutton="MailOnline"
      data-social-first-article-links>
  <ul class="article-icon-links cleared">
    <li class="facebook">

        <span class="linktext">
      <span class="bold">825</span>
    </span>
    </button>
</li>

    <li class="">
  <a class="comments-link" href="https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-8293349/Sweden-nears-horrifying-death-toll-3-000-coronavirus-87-new-fatalitie.html#comments" rel="nofollow">
    <span class="icon"></span>
    <span class="linktext">
        <span class="readerCommentNo bold" rel="8293349">703</span> comments
    </span>
  </a>
</li>

  </ul>

    <a itemprop="url" href="/news/article-8293091/Concerns-grow-disproportionate-impact-coronavirus-BAME-community.html">Only one white doctor has died from Covid-19, but 22 who were black or from an ethnic minority have lost their lives</a>
  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">
    <a href="/news/article-8293091/Concerns-grow-disproportionate-impact-coronavirus-BAME-community.html">
          <img

    </a>
    <p>
        
        Dr Craig Wakeham (pictured), a GP from Dorset, is believed to the only doctor who has died and is not from the Black, Asian and ethnic minority community. He died in mid-April.

                <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-tri-headline">
    <meta itemprop="position" content="11" />
    <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
        <a itemprop="url" href="/news/article-8293057/How-Neil-Fergusons-married-lover-enjoys-perfect-family-life.html" >How 'Professor Lockdown' fell for German lover who was married to a Battle of Britain pilot's grandson: Neil Ferguson had secret trysts with left-wing campaigner who's in an 'open marriage' with fellow academic</a>
    </h2>
    <div class="articletext">
        <a href="/news/article-8293057/How-Neil-Fergusons-married-lover-enjoys-perfect-family-life.html">
                <img 
                     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/18/28082248-0-image-m-24_1588785479186.jpg"
                     height="382" width="636" alt="How Neil Ferguson's married lover enjoys a perfect family life" 
                     style="max-width:100%" />
            
              <noscript>
            
                <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/18/28082248-0-image-m-24_1588785479186.jpg" height="382" width="636" alt="How Neil Ferguson's married lover enjoys a perfect family life" />
            
              </noscript>
        </a>
        <div >
        <p>
            
            Antonia Staats (centre left), 38, joked to neighbours in her affluent area of south-west London about her wealthy family's 'middle class problems' like 'sharing chores' and losing their au pair and cleaner - but admitted it had been 'challenging' and put a 'strain' on her marriage. Only Antonia's husband Chris (left) and a few close friends appear to have known that while Neil Ferguson, the academic known as 'Professor Lockdown' (centre right) espoused the virtues of staying apart from family and loved ones to save lives and protect the NHS, he himself was flagrantly flouting the rules he had helped create. Such was the brazenness of their affair, Professor Ferguson, 51, even happily spoke to BBC radio about the importance of adhering to the lockdown while he had his secret lover stashed in his flat for the first of their now public trysts. And his German-born mother of two lover had also left her happy family - Arabic professor husband Chris Lucas and their two children - to spend time with the Government scientist because she enjoyed an 'open marriage'. Professor Ferguson, 51, who is estranged from his wife Kim (right), was said to have been matched a year ago with Antonia on the OkCupid app used by 3.5million around the world to find love.  Ms Staats' husband and his wife's lookalike lover have even met, a friend claimed last night, and as well as sharing a passion for Antonia they also bonded over a love for data science. One friend of the couple told MailOnline: 'I last spoke to Chris and Antonia about a week ago. They were going out for a walk with their kids, which is what they've been doing every day. We just chatted about life in lockdown and how we're all coping. They're home schooling their kids and Antonia was saying how weird it all is because they had never spent so much time together. But she did say they've got a nice house with lots of space and are luckier than many other people.
        </p>
    </div>
</div>

                            <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-small">
  <meta itemprop="position" content="13" />
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a itemprop="url" href="/news/article-8291849/Elon-Musk-leads-anger-hypocritical-bonking-Professor-Lockdown-Neil-Ferguson.html">Elon Musk leads US anger at 'hypocritical' British 'Professor Lockdown' Neil Ferguson' over his rule-breaking trysts after issuing report that predicted 2m deaths in America </a>
  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">

               src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/10/28061914-0-image-m-19_1588756203926.jpg"

     data-followbutton="MailOnline"

                <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-tri-headline">
    <meta itemprop="position" content="14" />
    <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
        <a itemprop="url" href="/debate/article-8292387/JANET-STREET-PORTER-Let-superior-sex-free.html" >JANET STREET-PORTER: If it's good enough for Prof Lockdown's lover it's good enough for the rest of us - women do better than men against the virus so leave the blokes at home with their sourdough and let the superior sex free</a>
    </h2>
    <div class="articletext">
        <a href="/debate/article-8292387/JANET-STREET-PORTER-Let-superior-sex-free.html">
                <img 
                     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/14/28070398-0-image-m-13_1588773080837.jpg"
                     height="382" width="636" alt="JANET STREET-PORTER: Let the superior sex free" 
                     style="max-width:100%" />
            
              <noscript>
            
                <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/14/28070398-0-image-m-13_1588773080837.jpg" height="382" width="636" alt="JANET STREET-PORTER: Let the superior sex free" />
            
              </noscript>
        </a>
        <div >
        <p>
            
            Talk about double standards - when one of the 'experts' advising the Prime Minister can't even abide by his own recommendations, why should the rest of us? Professor Neil Ferguson (left) estimated that over 250,000 people would die from coronavirus in the UK unless a draconian lockdown was imposed, writes JANET STREET-PORTER. Now he's exposed as a hypocrite who can't abide by the same rules as the rest of us - caught out receiving nookie visits at home from his married lover who lives several miles away. The first on the same day that Professor Ferguson was telling the rest of us we might have to remain isolated until early June! The Professor claims he 'thought he was immune' as he had already isolated for two weeks after testing positive the virus - a feeble excuse which doesn't bear inspection as all over the country, ordinary citizens are forbidden family visits.
        </p>
    </div>
</div>

                <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-tri-headline">
    <meta itemprop="position" content="19" />
    <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
        <a itemprop="url" href="/news/article-8294013/New-Banksy-artwork-called-Game-Changer-appears-Southampton-hospital.html" >New Banksy artwork called Game Changer goes on display in hospital corridor as he thanks NHS staff for their work fighting coronavirus</a>
    </h2>
    <div class="articletext">
        <a href="/news/article-8294013/New-Banksy-artwork-called-Game-Changer-appears-Southampton-hospital.html">
                <img 
                     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/20/28084256-0-image-m-2_1588791995655.jpg"
                     height="688" width="636" alt="New Banksy artwork called Game Changer appears in Southampton hospital" 
                     style="max-width:100%" />
            
              <noscript>
            
                <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/20/28084256-0-image-m-2_1588791995655.jpg" height="688" width="636" alt="New Banksy artwork called Game Changer appears in Southampton hospital" />
            
              </noscript>
        </a>
        <div >
        <p>
            
            A new creation by mysterious street artist Bansky has appeared at Southampton general hospital, paying tribute to NHS staff during the coronavirus pandemic. Titled 'Game Changer,' the latest offered from the world renowned artist is almost a fully monochrome painting, depicting a young boy playing with toys. As ever with the world of Banksy, a thought-provoking twist is added.
        </p>
    </div>
</div>

  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">
    <a href="/news/article-8293417/66-New-York-coronavirus-hospitalizations-people-staying-HOME.html">
          <img 
               src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/17/28080402-0-image-m-34_1588783615316.jpg"

               style="max-width:100%" />
      
        <noscript>

        </noscript>
    </a>
    <p>
        
        In a study of some 1,000 new patients over the last week, 66 percent were not essential workers and were staying at home. More than 80 percent had not taken any public transport.
    </p>

     <p>

As he speaks to the young men, one of them grabs his bicycle and starts running off - as the person filming advises him to 'take the stand down'. The cameraman then taunts the humiliated PCSO, saying 'you just got robbed!' as the group around him laugh and jeer.

        <a href="/femail/food/article-8282385/Starbucks-Costa-Pret-reveal-recipes-recreate-cafe-favourites-home.html">
                <img 
                     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/15/28076268-0-image-a-4_1588776729931.jpg"
                     height="382" width="636" alt="Starbucks, Costa, and Pret reveal the recipes to recreate the cafe favourites at home" 
                     style="max-width:100%" />
            
              <noscript>
            
                <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/15/28076268-0-image-a-4_1588776729931.jpg" height="382" width="636" alt="Starbucks, Costa, and Pret reveal the recipes to recreate the cafe favourites at home" />
            
              </noscript>
        </a>
        <div >
        <p>
            
            EXCLUSIVE: Starbucks has revealed how to make its Frappucino, Iced Coffee and Cold Brew at home, and Pret a Manger shared the recipe for its Coffee Frappe with Femail to satisfy lockdown cravings. Femail has also spoken to experts to find out how to get the professional taste at home, from the beans to buy to the tools to use. Clockwise from top left: Chains have shared recipes for Pret's Coffee Frappe; Starbucks' Cold Brew, Costa's Latte, Grind's cappuccino, Dishoom's Masala Chai and CHIN-CHIN's hot chocolate.
        </p>
    </div>
</div>

                            <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-small">
  <meta itemprop="position" content="36" />
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a itemprop="url" href="/news/article-8292895/Sir-Frederick-Barclays-nephews-sold-Ritz-half-market-price-court-hears.html">Sir Frederick Barclay's nephews sold the Ritz hotel for 'half the market price of 1.3billion' after 'commercial espionage on a vast scale' when they secretly recorded his conversations with a Saudi investor, court hears</a>
  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">

    <p>
        
        A preliminary hearing conducted remotely today heard the London landmark hotel was sold for 'half the market price' by Sir Frederick Barclay's nephews.

  </h2>
  <a href="/femail/article-8292329/Teenage-police-cadet-14-praised-making-TikTok-film-domestic-abuse-lockdown.html">
    <img data-mol-fe-video-preview

    <div >
     <p>
       
       Kaitlyn McGoldrick, 14, from Cleveland, in north east England, told Sky News host Kay Burley that she decided to help make the video - which sees her appearing with bruised skin on the phone to police - to raise awareness about how young people enduring abuse can seek help. (Pictured: Police cadet Kaitlyn McGoldrick starring in the TikTok video)

    <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
        <a itemprop="url" href="/tvshowbiz/article-8291397/Adele-looks-unrecognizable-shows-amazing-figure-tight-black-mini-32nd-birthday.html" >Adele shows off her amazing slimmed-down figure in a tight black mini dress on her 32nd birthday in her first Instagram post since she debuted dramatic seven stone weight loss</a>
    </h2>
    <div class="articletext">
        <a href="/tvshowbiz/article-8291397/Adele-looks-unrecognizable-shows-amazing-figure-tight-black-mini-32nd-birthday.html">
                <img 
                     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/19/28060020-0-image-m-1_1588790698589.jpg"

              </noscript>
        </a>
        <div >
        <p>
            
            The singer showed off her incredible transformation (left) as she posed for an Instagram snap on Tuesday. The Hello hitmaker was celebrating her 32nd birthday and stood beaming in her backyard behind a giant floral wreath. She wrote: 'Thank you for the birthday love. I hope you're all staying safe and sane during this crazy time,' (left inset). Her friend Lauren, 33, married to actor Aaron Paul, 40, also shared a throwback picture of them partying in Vegas with Nicole Richie (right). The superstar has always looked beautiful but looks drastically different to her appearance at London's Brit Awards in 2016, (centre inset).
        </p>

  <meta itemprop="position" content="43" />
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a itemprop="url" href="/news/article-8291735/May-bank-holiday-meltdown-Temperatures-set-soar-77F-VE-Day.html">May bank holiday meltdown! Temperatures are set to soar to 79F on VE Day weekend fuelled by an 800-mile wide Mediterranean plume</a>
  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">
    <a href="/news/article-8291735/May-bank-holiday-meltdown-Temperatures-set-soar-77F-VE-Day.html">
          <img 
               src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/12/28068580-0-image-a-58_1588764086274.jpg"
               height="115" width="154" alt="" 
               style="max-width:100%" />
      
        <noscript>
      
          <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/12/28068580-0-image-a-58_1588764086274.jpg" height="115" width="154" alt="" />
      
        </noscript>
    </a>
    <p>
        
        The Met Office forecast temperatures to hit up to 77F (25C) on Friday, with London possibly seeing 79F (26C) on Saturday, as a plume of hot air from the southern Mediterranean wafts across the UK.
    </p>
  </div>
  <div class="article-icon-links-container"
     data-followbutton="MailOnline"

'I begged Angel, any place but England,' she said. 'And one year later we were in Manchester, s***.'

                <div class="article article-tri-headline">
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a href="/femail/article-8292753/Former-Disneyland-employee-reveals-celebrity-v-isitors-really-like.html">Former Disneyland employee reveals what celebrity visitors to the park were REALLY like, branding Mariah Carey and Nick Cannon 'awful divas' and calling Nicholas Cage 'creepy'</a>
  </h2>
  <a href="/femail/article-8292753/Former-Disneyland-employee-reveals-celebrity-v-isitors-really-like.html">
    <img data-mol-fe-video-preview
     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7"
     data-src="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/3219517395501990285/636x382_JPG-SINGLE_3219517395501990285.jpg"
     width="636"
     height=382
     data-video="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/3219517395501990285/636x382_MP4_3219517395501990285.mp4"
     data-film="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/3219517395501990285/308x174_JPG_3219517395501990285.jpg"
     data-frame-width="308"
     data-frame-height="184"
     data-frame-count="70"
     data-fps="7"
     data-hd-film="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/3219517395501990285/636x382_JPG-HD_3219517395501990285.jpg"
     data-hd-frame-width="636"
     data-hd-frame-height="382"
     data-hd-frame-count="70"
     data-hd-fps="7" />
<noscript>
    <img src="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/3219517395501990285/636x382_JPG-SINGLE_3219517395501990285.jpg" width="636" height=382 />
</noscript>

  </a>
  <div class="articletext">
    <div >
     <p>
       
       Nicole Smith, 31, used to work at Disneyland in California. In a series of TikTok videos, she named all of the celebrities she encountered at the park and what her experiences with them were. She said Mariah Carey and Nick Cannon were both 'divas' and 'awful'. She said Kobe Bryant was 'so sweet and his family was so sweet,' while Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg were both nice. Ross Lynch was 'annoying,' Nicolas Cage was 'creepy,' and Mary J. Blige was 'the nicest person'.
     </p>
    </div>
  </div>

     data-followbutton="Femail"

        <a href="/news/article-8274579/Colourised-pictures-Spanish-flu-100-years-ago-people-wearing-identical-Covid-masks.html">
                <img 
                     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/05/14/28029746-0-image-a-29_1588685241779.jpg"
                     height="382" width="636" alt="Colourised pictures from Spanish flu 100 years ago show people wearing almost identical" 
                     style="max-width:100%" />
            
              <noscript>
            
                <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/05/14/28029746-0-image-a-29_1588685241779.jpg" height="382" width="636" alt="Colourised pictures from Spanish flu 100 years ago show people wearing almost identical" />
            
              </noscript>
        </a>
        <div >
        <p>
            
            Face masks became a vital piece of equipment in 1918 - be it for those out for a stroll on a street, Red Cross nurses treating the injured or a worker spraying the top of a London bus. While many masks were made of cotton, some innovated and hooked themselves up to breathing contraptions, believing the air itself was toxic. These photos have been brought to life by online geneology website MyHeritage, whose colouring tool can now be used by anyone to update their black and white photographs. The 'Spanish' flu cut down a swathe of humanity towards the end of the First World War, lasting from January 1918 to December 1920 and killing about 50 million people.
        </p>
    </div>
</div>
<div class="article-icon-links-container"
     data-followbutton="MailOnline"
     >
  <ul class="article-icon-links cleared">
    <li class="first">

                <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-tri-headline">
    <meta itemprop="position" content="63" />
    <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
        <a itemprop="url" href="/news/article-8293163/Travellers-set-camp-council-car-parks-yards-coronavirus-testing-centre.html" >Travellers set up camp in council car parks within yards of coronavirus testing centre</a>
    </h2>
    <div class="articletext">
        <a href="/news/article-8293163/Travellers-set-camp-council-car-parks-yards-coronavirus-testing-centre.html">
                <img 
                     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/17/28080904-0-image-a-11_1588782183265.jpg"

                     style="max-width:100%" />
            
              <noscript>
            
                <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/17/28080904-0-image-a-11_1588782183265.jpg" height="382" width="636" alt="Travellers set up camp in council car parks within yards of coronavirus testing centre" />
            
              </noscript>
        </a>
        <div >
        <p>
            
            A group of travellers have pitched up in two council car parks in north Devon (main), just yards from a coronavirus testing centre. The group, consisting of ten caravans and vehicles. arrived at Seven Brethren lorry park and Tarka park in Barnstaple (inset) on Monday afternoon. The location is mere yards from the military-operated covid-19 test centre in North Devon Leisure Centre's car park. North Devon council are investigating the matter.
        </p>
    </div>
</div>

  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">
    <a href="/femail/article-8292279/Modern-day-Juliet-recalls-date-man-fell-love-sight-with.html">
          <img 
               src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/13/28069790-0-image-a-1_1588766434933.jpg"

               style="max-width:100%" />
      
        <noscript>
      
          <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/13/28069790-0-image-a-1_1588766434933.jpg" height="115" width="154" alt="" />
      
        </noscript>
    </a>
    <p>
        
        Paola Agnelli, 39, told This Morning how she first laid eyes on Michele D'Alpaos, 39, who lives across the road in Verona, Italy, when they both stepped out onto their balconies to listen to a community concert.
    </p>
  </div>

     data-followbutton="Femail"

                <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-tri-headline">
    <meta itemprop="position" content="68" />
    <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
        <a itemprop="url" href="/femail/article-8293303/Brit-couple-spend-lockdown-living-transit-van-Spain-two-young-children.html" >Couple who left the UK to travel Europe with their two young children in a camper van reveal the claustrophobia of being confined for seven weeks has been 'tough' - and they homeschool their kids by colouring in and 'counting cars'</a>
    </h2>
    <div class="articletext">
        <a href="/femail/article-8293303/Brit-couple-spend-lockdown-living-transit-van-Spain-two-young-children.html">
                <img 
                     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/17/28080650-0-image-a-57_1588782069961.jpg"
                     height="382" width="636" alt="Brit couple spend lockdown living in a transit van in Spain with two young children" 
                     style="max-width:100%" />
            
              <noscript>
            
                <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/17/28080650-0-image-a-57_1588782069961.jpg" height="382" width="636" alt="Brit couple spend lockdown living in a transit van in Spain with two young children" />
            
              </noscript>
        </a>
        <div >
        <p>
            
            A British couple who are travelling around Spain in a modified transit van has told how being trapped in there with two young children and unable to go to the beach during lockdown has been 'tough'. Pete Russell, 27, originally from Long Eaton, and his wife Hannah, 25, from Bingham, decided to leave England for sunnier climates after a series of tragic events.Having lost a child, and suffering with depression, the pair sold off their worldly possessions and spent 3,000 on an old white Mercedes Sprinter which they modified into a living space (top centre, bottom left and bottom right). With their two kids in tow - Felix, four, and Angus, three, pictured together top left and bottom centre - they decided to cruise across Europe, parking up in beach car parks and living off a modest weekly budget of 60 euros. The family have lived this way since April last year - and have just celebrated their one year anniversary of living their life on the road. But then their new sense of freedom started to collapse as the coronavirus hit Spain and they had to remain confined to their van for seven weeks. Pictured top right: Hannah collecting water.
        </p>
    </div>
</div>
<div class="article-icon-links-container"
     data-followbutton="Femail"
     >

    <span class="linktext">
        <span class="readerCommentNo bold" rel="8293303">14</span> comments
    </span>

  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">
    <a href="/news/article-8292151/Scottish-shop-worker-tries-making-face-mask-sock-goes-hilariously-wrong.html">
          <img 
               src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/14/28073470-0-image-a-62_1588772701858.jpg"

    <p>

     data-followbutton="MailOnline"
     >
  <ul class="article-icon-links cleared">
    <li class="first">

  <div class="thin-split ccox link-ccox linkro-box bdrcc">
    <h6>
            
    </h6>
</div>

    <div class="cleared lead-alpha">
          <div class="alpha">
                <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-tri-headline exclusive">
    <meta itemprop="position" content="75" />
    <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
        <a itemprop="url" href="/news/article-8265039/Westworld-star-Louis-Herthum-searches-sisters-killer-50-years-murders.html" >'I'll never let it go.' Westworld star Louis Herthum - who was 16 when his two sisters were murdered execution-style - tells of his 50-year hunt for their killer and how he's discovered new evidence in an effort to crack the 1972 Miami cold case</a>
    </h2>
    <div class="articletext">
        <a href="/news/article-8265039/Westworld-star-Louis-Herthum-searches-sisters-killer-50-years-murders.html">
                <img 
                     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/04/28/17/27758516-0-image-a-46_1588090982312.jpg"
                     height="382" width="636" alt="Westworld star Louis Herthum searches for his sisters' killer 50 years after murders" 
                     style="max-width:100%" />
            
              <noscript>
            
                <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/04/28/17/27758516-0-image-a-46_1588090982312.jpg" height="382" width="636" alt="Westworld star Louis Herthum searches for his sisters' killer 50 years after murders" />
            
              </noscript>
        </a>
        <div >
        <p>
            
            Westworld actor Louis Herthum's two sisters were murdered execution-style in a drug operation gone wrong in a Miami apartment in October 1972. Herthum was just 16 when his sisters Denise, 20, and Diane, 18, and Denise's boyfriend Jack Smith, 31, were killed by three assailants. Authorities claim the original investigation involved more than 70 suspects and 200 witnesses but Miami Police failed to crack the case. Herthum has never stopped searching for justice, hiring private investigators and bring new evidence to police. 'I'll never let it go,' Herthum said in an exclusive interview with DailyMail.com. 'My sisters were two extraordinary human beings, beautiful, sweet girls. They were in the wrong place at the wrong time, and it's not something you ever get over,' he added.
        </p>
    </div>
</div>

     data-followbutton="MailOnline"

    </span>

                <div class="article article-tri-headline">
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a href="/news/article-8292123/Chinas-spider-man-cleaner-picks-litter-vertical-cliff-face-little-protection.html">Amazing drone footage shows China's 'spider-man cleaner' picking litter on a vertical cliff face nearly 4,600 feet above the ground</a>
  </h2>
  <a href="/news/article-8292123/Chinas-spider-man-cleaner-picks-litter-vertical-cliff-face-little-protection.html">
    <img data-mol-fe-video-preview
     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7"
     data-src="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/6096387435081646164/636x382_JPG-SINGLE_6096387435081646164.jpg"
     width="636"
     height=380
     data-video="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/6096387435081646164/636x382_MP4_6096387435081646164.mp4"

     data-frame-width="308"
     data-frame-height="184"
     data-frame-count="66"
     data-fps="7"
     data-hd-film="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/6096387435081646164/636x382_JPG-HD_6096387435081646164.jpg"
     data-hd-frame-width="636"
     data-hd-frame-height="380"
     data-hd-frame-count="66"
     data-hd-fps="7" />
<noscript>
    <img src="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/6096387435081646164/636x382_JPG-SINGLE_6096387435081646164.jpg" width="636" height=380 />
</noscript>

  </a>
  <div class="articletext">
    <div >
     <p>
       
       With a hardhat, a harness and a rope, these so-called 'spider-man cleaners' need to collect garbage left by visitors on dangerous cliff faces in Zhangjiajie, south-western China. Dizzying drone footage shows one such daredevil litter picker undertaking the highly risky task as he clung onto trees on a rock face at nearly 4,600 feet above the ground. The video was taken on the Tianmen or Heaven's Gate Mountain in Zhangjiajie when it welcomed tourists on May 1, the first national holiday in China since officials lifted quarantine restrictions.
     </p>
    </div>
  </div>
  <div class="article-icon-links-container"
     data-followbutton="MailOnline"
     >
  <ul class="article-icon-links cleared">
    <li class="first">

    <span class="icon"></span>
    <span class="linktext">
        <span class="readerCommentNo bold" rel="8292123">64</span> comments
    </span>

    <span class="icon"></span>

  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a itemprop="url" href="/sciencetech/article-8291757/Spending-time-garden-improves-health-living-wealthy-area.html">Spending time relaxing in your garden or tending to the flowerbeds improves mental and physical wellbeing 'as much as living in a wealthy area'</a>
  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">
    <a href="/sciencetech/article-8291757/Spending-time-garden-improves-health-living-wealthy-area.html">
          <img 
               src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/08/28061998-0-image-a-5_1588751134757.jpg"

        </noscript>
    </a>
    <p>
        
        The study, led by scientists at the University of Exeter and the RHS found 71 per cent of individuals who used their garden were in good health, compared with just 61 per cent who did not use the space.
    </p>

                <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-tri-headline">
    <meta itemprop="position" content="101" />
    <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
        <a itemprop="url" href="/femail/article-8292339/Duke-Gloucester-wife-offer-look-inside-Kensington-Palace-cottage.html" >Queen's cousin the Duke of Gloucester and his wife offer first ever look inside their Kensington Palace cottage that once belonged to royal aide Sir 'Tommy Lascelles - complete with desk trinkets and jade carvings</a>
    </h2>
    <div class="articletext">
        <a href="/femail/article-8292339/Duke-Gloucester-wife-offer-look-inside-Kensington-Palace-cottage.html">
                <img 
                     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/14/28071434-0-image-a-145_1588772602943.jpg"
                     height="382" width="636" alt="Duke of Gloucester and his wife offer first ever look inside their Kensington Palace" 
                     style="max-width:100%" />
            
              <noscript>
            
                <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/14/28071434-0-image-a-145_1588772602943.jpg" height="382" width="636" alt="Duke of Gloucester and his wife offer first ever look inside their Kensington Palace" />
            
              </noscript>
        </a>
        <div >
        <p>
            
            The Duke of Gloucester, a first cousin of the Queen, and his wife live in the Old Stables, a historic cottage in the grounds of the palace, which is home to several members of the royal family including Princess Eugenie and the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge. Royal fans were given a first look inside when these photos were shared on Twitter. They show the Duke in front of an extensive book collection (1) and the Duchess at a busy desk decorated with animal trinkets (2); jade carvings (3); an ornamental silver basket (4); a horse statuette (5); a commemorative tankard (6) and a framed painting of the Changing of the Guards (7).
        </p>
    </div>
</div>

                <div class="article article-tri-headline">
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a href="/news/article-8293817/US-hostage-paraded-Venezuelan-TV.html">US hostage Luke Denman is paraded on Venezuelan TV and 'admits to plot to capture Nicolas Madoro' </a>
  </h2>
  <a href="/news/article-8293817/US-hostage-paraded-Venezuelan-TV.html">
    <img data-mol-fe-video-preview
     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7"
     data-src="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/2801375811558657222/636x382_JPG-SINGLE_2801375811558657222.jpg"
     width="636"
     height=382
     data-video="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/2801375811558657222/636x382_MP4_2801375811558657222.mp4"
     data-film="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/2801375811558657222/308x174_JPG_2801375811558657222.jpg"
     data-frame-width="308"
     data-frame-height="184"
     data-frame-count="67"
     data-fps="7"
     data-hd-film="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/2801375811558657222/636x382_JPG-HD_2801375811558657222.jpg"
     data-hd-frame-width="636"
     data-hd-frame-height="382"
     data-hd-frame-count="67"
     data-hd-fps="7" />
<noscript>
    <img src="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/2801375811558657222/636x382_JPG-SINGLE_2801375811558657222.jpg" width="636" height=382 />
</noscript>

  </a>
  <div class="articletext">
    <div >
     <p>
       
       A former U.S. special force soldier arrested in Venezuela on Monday was paraded on Venezuelan TV on Wednesday as he 'admitted to a plot to capture President Nicolas Maduro'.  Luke Denman, 34, was arrested alongside six Venezuelan mercenaries as part of the foiled coup. The coup was coordinated by an ex-Green Beret named Jordan Goudreau, 43, who says the objective was to capture Maduro. Goudreau claims to have built a force of 300 men, reportedly backed by US billionaires.
     </p>
    </div>

  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">
    <a href="/news/article-8293535/Lynx-advert-showing-squirrel-humping-deodorant-causes-outrage.html">
          <img 
               src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/18/28082718-0-image-a-6_1588785961310.jpg"

               style="max-width:100%" />
      
        <noscript>

        </noscript>
    </a>
    <p>
        
        Britain's Got Talent viewers complained about the 60-second advert which was broadcast 15 minutes before the 9pm watershed on Saturday night.

                            <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-small">

  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a itemprop="url" href="/sciencetech/article-8292353/Scientists-design-plasma-powered-jet-propulsion-system.html">Fossil fuel-free jet propulsion system powered by PLASMA can generate the same amount of thrust as a commercial jet engine, scientists claim</a>
  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">
    <a href="/sciencetech/article-8292353/Scientists-design-plasma-powered-jet-propulsion-system.html">
          <img 
               src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/11/28066658-0-image-a-12_1588760986506.jpg"
               height="115" width="154" alt="" 
               style="max-width:100%" />
      
        <noscript>
      
          <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/11/28066658-0-image-a-12_1588760986506.jpg" height="115" width="154" alt="" />
      
        </noscript>
    </a>
    <p>
        
        Scientists have developed an environmentally friendly plasma-powered jet engine that needs just air and electricity to propel itself forward rather than fossil fuels.
    </p>
  </div>
  <div class="article-icon-links-container"
     data-followbutton="MailOnline"
     >
  <ul class="article-icon-links cleared">

  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a itemprop="url" href="/sciencetech/article-8293293/Underwater-forest-hydrothermal-vents-coast-Washington-mapped-time.html">Underwater forest of hydrothermal vents off the coast of Washington State is mapped for the first time, revealing more than 500 spirals with some standing 90 feet tall</a>
  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">
    <a href="/sciencetech/article-8293293/Underwater-forest-hydrothermal-vents-coast-Washington-mapped-time.html">
          <img 
               src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/16/28079234-0-image-a-15_1588780624544.jpg"

        </noscript>
    </a>
    <p>
        
        An underwater forest of massive hydrothermal vents has been mapped for the first time off the coast of Washington State. There are more than 500 spirals over eight miles of seabed.

  </h2>

    <div >
     <p>
       
       A pair of mischievous foxes got their daily dose of news when they stole a paper from Kate Fisher's doorstep in East London. Ms Fisher checked her doorbell camera footage to find out where her paper had disappeared to and found the adorable clip of the cubs playing with it before dragging it off into the bushes. They join a number of foxes making the most of emptier streets during the coronavirus lockdown.

  <div class="thin-split ccox link-ccox linkro-box bdrcc">
    <h6>
            
    </h6>
</div>

</div>

                <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-tri-headline">
    <meta itemprop="position" content="123" />
    <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
        <a itemprop="url" href="/news/article-8292451/Stunning-portraits-reveal-Indian-tribes-including-wife-swapping-Himalayan-Drokpas-people.html" >Stunning portraits reveal Indian tribes including 'wife-swapping' Himalayan Drokpa people, Konyak 'head hunters' and Aghori gurus who smear human ashes on their skin</a>
    </h2>
    <div class="articletext">
        <a href="/news/article-8292451/Stunning-portraits-reveal-Indian-tribes-including-wife-swapping-Himalayan-Drokpas-people.html">
                <img 
                     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/13/28069820-0-image-a-91_1588766530448.jpg"
                     height="382" width="636" alt="Stunning portraits reveal Indian tribes including wife-swapping Himalayan Drokpas people" 
                     style="max-width:100%" />
            
              <noscript>
            
                <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/13/28069820-0-image-a-91_1588766530448.jpg" height="382" width="636" alt="Stunning portraits reveal Indian tribes including wife-swapping Himalayan Drokpas people" />
            
              </noscript>
        </a>
        <div >
        <p>
            
            The striking images are part of a series called 'The Last Avatar' and were taken by photographer Aman Chotani, 31, from Delhi, India. The photographer's aim is to educate people about Indian communities and to help stop them from dying out. Mr Chotani travelled to 10 Indian states to capture each image; Gujrat, Rajasthan, Nagaland, Arunachal Pradesh, Varanasi, Odisha, Uttarakhand, Ladakh, Himachal Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, and Karnataka. The stunning photos capture the incredibly diverse tribes of India, including members of the 'wife-swapping' Himalayan Drokpas people, the Konyak 'headhunters' and the solumn faces of the Apatani in the Ziro valley.
        </p>
    </div>
</div>

                <div class="home item thin_divide module">
  <div class="thin-split ccox link-ccox linkro-box bdrcc">
    <h6>
            
    </h6>
</div>

</div>

                <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-tri-headline exclusive">
    <meta itemprop="position" content="128" />
    <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
        <a itemprop="url" href="/news/article-8289905/Hundreds-flock-Joe-Exotics-zoo-reopening-finally-cashing-Netflix-fame.html" >It's grrrreat! Hundreds flock to Joe Exotic's infamous zoo for its reopening, as it finally cashes in on Netflix fame and fans can meet Tiger King stars Jeff Lowe, head zookeeper Erik Cowie and 'hitman' Allen Glover</a>
    </h2>
    <div class="articletext">
        <a href="/news/article-8289905/Hundreds-flock-Joe-Exotics-zoo-reopening-finally-cashing-Netflix-fame.html">
                <img 
                     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/13/28071078-0-image-a-2_1588769665899.jpg"
                     height="382" width="636" alt="Hundreds visit Joe Exotic zoo as it reopens after Netflix fame" 
                     style="max-width:100%" />
            
              <noscript>
            
                <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/13/28071078-0-image-a-2_1588769665899.jpg" height="382" width="636" alt="Hundreds visit Joe Exotic zoo as it reopens after Netflix fame" />
            
              </noscript>
        </a>
        <div >
        <p>
            
            Hundreds of fans were seen flocking to the zoo once owned by Joe Exotic over the weekend, exclusive photos by DailyMail.com show. There were long lines to get inside the zoo in Wynnewood, Oklahoma, as people waited to get a glimpse of the infamous zoo, now renamed Tiger King Park, as the zoo finally cashes in on its Netflix fame. The zoo has been closed since Oklahoma issued a stay at home order, but over the weekend it was allowed to reopen using CDC recommended social distancing and sanitation protocols. However, once inside, throngs of people ignored social distancing rules as they went without face masks and clamored to get an up-close look at the park's tigers, as well as sitting shoulder-to-shoulder to pet tiger cubs. The docuseries focused on zoo owner Joe Exotic, who was sentenced to 22 years in federal prison last year. He was jailed for hiring a hit-man to kill his arch nemesis Carole Baskin and for more than a dozen wildlife violations, including killing five tigers. Now it's under ownership by Jeff Lowe and his wife Lauren, who were seen greeting guests over the weekend.
        </p>
    </div>
</div>

    <p>

  <div class="article-icon-links-container"
     data-followbutton="Femail"

                            <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-small">
  <meta itemprop="position" content="136" />
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a itemprop="url" href="/femail/article-8292037/Marian-Keyes-reveals-shes-writing-sequel-Rachels-Holiday-22-years-original-release.html">Marian Keyes reveals she's writing a sequel to bestseller Rachel's Holiday 22 years after its original release - and admits she's 'terrified' it could go wrong</a>
  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">
    <a href="/femail/article-8292037/Marian-Keyes-reveals-shes-writing-sequel-Rachels-Holiday-22-years-original-release.html">
          <img 
               src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/11/28066274-0-image-a-3_1588759872021.jpg"
               height="115" width="154" alt="" 
               style="max-width:100%" />
      
        <noscript>
      
          <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/11/28066274-0-image-a-3_1588759872021.jpg" height="115" width="154" alt="" />

    </a>
    <p>
        
        Marian Keyes, of Dublin, has admitted that she's terrified of 'damaging' her character's universe when appearing on Lorraine today and revealing that she's writing a sequel for Rachel's Holiday
    </p>
  </div>
  <div class="article-icon-links-container"
     data-followbutton="Femail"
     >
  <ul class="article-icon-links cleared">
    <li class="first">
  <a class="comments-link" href="https://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-8292037/Marian-Keyes-reveals-shes-writing-sequel-Rachels-Holiday-22-years-original-release.html#comments" rel="nofollow">

  </a>
</li>

    <li class=" gr3ox">

  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a itemprop="url" href="/femail/article-8289323/Top-20-popular-decor-trends-online-revealed.html">How Insta-worthy is YOUR home? The 20 decor trends that will get you the most likes revealed - including macram wall hangings, feature walls and Smeg fridges</a>
  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">
    <a href="/femail/article-8289323/Top-20-popular-decor-trends-online-revealed.html">

               src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/05/18/28038692-0-image-a-38_1588698866513.jpg"

        <noscript>
      
          <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/05/18/28038692-0-image-a-38_1588698866513.jpg" height="115" width="154" alt="" />
      
        </noscript>
    </a>
    <p>
        
        British bathroom specialists Drenched.co.uk have revealed the most popular home trends on Instagram, including Macrame wall hangings, feature walls and kitchen islands.
    </p>

                <div class="article article-tri-headline">
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a href="/travel/escape/article-8289181/The-new-hotel-formed-train-carriages-positioned-BRIDGE-Africas-Kruger-National-Park.html">The amazing new hotel formed from train carriages positioned on a BRIDGE in Africa's Kruger National Park - with epic views of wildlife from the rooms and sensational overhanging pool</a>
  </h2>
  <a href="/travel/escape/article-8289181/The-new-hotel-formed-train-carriages-positioned-BRIDGE-Africas-Kruger-National-Park.html">
    <img data-mol-fe-video-preview
     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7"
     data-src="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/5313420057847548892/636x382_JPG-SINGLE_5313420057847548892.jpg"
     width="636"
     height=382
     data-video="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/5313420057847548892/636x382_MP4_5313420057847548892.mp4"
     data-film="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/5313420057847548892/308x174_JPG_5313420057847548892.jpg"
     data-frame-width="308"
     data-frame-height="184"
     data-frame-count="46"
     data-fps="7"
     data-hd-film="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/5313420057847548892/636x382_JPG-HD_5313420057847548892.jpg"
     data-hd-frame-width="636"
     data-hd-frame-height="382"
     data-hd-frame-count="46"
     data-hd-fps="7" />
<noscript>
    <img src="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/5313420057847548892/636x382_JPG-SINGLE_5313420057847548892.jpg" width="636" height=382 />
</noscript>

  </a>
  <div class="articletext">
    <div >
     <p>
       
       It's a stopping service like no other. Behold what is surely going to be one of the most sensational hotel openings of 2020 - a set of 13 restored train carriages that will house 31 luxury rooms positioned on an epic bridge inside South Africa's Kruger National Park. Views of the local wildlife will be afforded to guests from every room - and from the overhanging outdoor pool, which is sure to be a smash hit on Instagram. In fact, animals including crocodiles, hippos, buffaloes and elephants are likely to be seen in and around the bridge. The hotel - called Kruger Shalati: The Train on the Bridge - is currently under construction on the 984ft (300m) Selati Bridge, erected across the Sabie River in 1912.
     </p>
    </div>
  </div>
  <div class="article-icon-links-container"
     data-followbutton="travelmail"
     >
  <ul class="article-icon-links cleared">
    <li class="first">

    <span class="icon"></span>
    <span class="linktext">
        <span class="readerCommentNo bold" rel="8289181">29</span> comments
    </span>
  </a>
</li>

    <li class="">

    <span class="icon"></span>
    <span class="linktext">
      <span class="bold">1</span> video
    </span>
  </a>
</li>

    <li class=" gr3ox">
<a class="https://mol.im/a/8289181| js-sl share-link" data-social-drawer="true" data-url="https://www.dailymail.co.uk/travel/escape/article-8289181/The-new-hotel-formed-train-carriages-positioned-BRIDGE-Africas-Kruger-National-Park.html" data-email-share-style="email_share_article-drawer" data-headline="The amazing new hotel formed from train carriages positioned on a BRIDGE in Africa's Kruger National Park - with epic views of wildlife from the rooms and sensational overhanging pool" data-article-image="/1s/2020/05/06/11/28067212-0-image-a-45_1588761539745.jpg" data-show-flipboard="true"  data-show-fbmessenger="true"   href="#">

                <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-tri-headline">
    <meta itemprop="position" content="139" />
    <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
        <a itemprop="url" href="/femail/article-8288479/Girl-12-transforms-family-home-seven-days-just-50-homeschooling.html" >Girl, 12, transforms her family home in seven days for just 50 in between home schooling - and even used a power drill and handsaw (with only a little help from her mum and brother)</a>
    </h2>
    <div class="articletext">
        <a href="/femail/article-8288479/Girl-12-transforms-family-home-seven-days-just-50-homeschooling.html">
                <img 
                     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/05/13/28028870-0-image-a-42_1588683455419.jpg"
                     height="382" width="636" alt="Girl, 12, transforms her family home in seven days for just 50 in between homeschooling" 
                     style="max-width:100%" />
            
              <noscript>
            
                <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/05/13/28028870-0-image-a-42_1588683455419.jpg" height="382" width="636" alt="Girl, 12, transforms her family home in seven days for just 50 in between homeschooling" />
            
              </noscript>
        </a>
        <div >
        <p>
            
            Mother Susie Levache, 47, from Kent, has revealed how her 12-year-old daughter Bea (inset) transformed their home in seven days for just 50 in between home schooling lessons during lockdown. The portrait photographer told FEMAIL Bea was 'a natural' and did a 'blinding job' - and before and after photos which she shared to Facebook received thousands of positive comments. Susie added that she and Bea's brother Ted, 15, also lent a hand, and the family aims to reuse as much as possible, so only needed to buy a few extra items from eBay for the projects. Pictured top (left to right) Susie's utility, stairs and home office before their transformation, and pictured bottom row, the after shots.
        </p>
    </div>
</div>

     data-followbutton="Femail"

    </span>
  </a>
</li>

                            <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-small">
  <meta itemprop="position" content="141" />
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a itemprop="url" href="/femail/article-8288917/Grade-manor-designed-architect-Cenotaph-goes-sale-5-5million.html">Grade I listed manor house described as the 'best work' of architect Sir Edwin Lutyens who designed The Cenotaph goes on sale for 5.5million - and comes complete with nine bedrooms, its own cottage and a gym</a>
  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">
    <a href="/femail/article-8288917/Grade-manor-designed-architect-Cenotaph-goes-sale-5-5million.html">
          <img 
               src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/05/17/28036872-0-image-a-229_1588695727314.jpg"
               height="115" width="154" alt="" 
               style="max-width:100%" />
      
        <noscript>
      
          <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/05/17/28036872-0-image-a-229_1588695727314.jpg" height="115" width="154" alt="" />
      
        </noscript>
    </a>
    <p>
        
        Little Thakeham, in West Sussex, was built in 1902 by Sir Edwin Lutyens, who has been described as the best British architect of the 20C for his stunning creations including the Centograph in Whitehall.
    </p>
  </div>
  <div class="article-icon-links-container"
     data-followbutton="Femail"
     >
  <ul class="article-icon-links cleared">
    <li class="first">

    <span class="icon"></span>
    <span class="linktext">
        <span class="readerCommentNo bold" rel="8288917">37</span> comments
    </span>
  </a>
</li>

    <li class=" gr3ox">

                <div class="article article-tri-headline">
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a href="/news/article-8293237/Press-ups-wimps-Gym-goer-takes-push-ups-new-level.html">Gym-goer takes push ups to a whole new level with intense workout that sees him leaping up and landing on his elbows</a>
  </h2>
  <a href="/news/article-8293237/Press-ups-wimps-Gym-goer-takes-push-ups-new-level.html">
    <img data-mol-fe-video-preview
     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7"
     data-src="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/8508820083975930526/636x382_JPG-SINGLE_8508820083975930526.jpg"
     width="636"
     height=382
     data-video="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/8508820083975930526/636x382_MP4_8508820083975930526.mp4"
     data-film="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/8508820083975930526/308x174_JPG_8508820083975930526.jpg"
     data-frame-width="308"
     data-frame-height="184"
     data-frame-count="63"
     data-fps="7"
     data-hd-film="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/8508820083975930526/636x382_JPG-HD_8508820083975930526.jpg"
     data-hd-frame-width="636"
     data-hd-frame-height="382"
     data-hd-frame-count="63"
     data-hd-fps="7" />
<noscript>
    <img src="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/8508820083975930526/636x382_JPG-SINGLE_8508820083975930526.jpg" width="636" height=382 />
</noscript>

  </a>
  <div class="articletext">
    <div >
     <p>
       
       Epic 21-second clip shows the man racing through five different press up types. The footage shows the man exercising as another individual appears to barely move in the background. The intense regime, carried out after a two hour work out, was filmed in Herblay, France, before the lockdown was brought into force.
     </p>
    </div>
  </div>

          <div class="alpha">
                <div class="article article-tri-headline">
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a href="/news/article-8292769/Video-shows-professional-surfers-daring-ride-storm-drain-Hawaii-COVID-19.html">Amazing video shows a professional surfer's daring ride down a storm drain in Hawaii</a>
  </h2>
  <a href="/news/article-8292769/Video-shows-professional-surfers-daring-ride-storm-drain-Hawaii-COVID-19.html">
    <img data-mol-fe-video-preview
     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7"
     data-src="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/695922967222730134/636x382_JPG-SINGLE_695922967222730134.jpg"
     width="636"
     height=382
     data-video="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/695922967222730134/636x382_MP4_695922967222730134.mp4"
     data-film="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/695922967222730134/308x174_JPG_695922967222730134.jpg"
     data-frame-width="308"
     data-frame-height="184"
     data-frame-count="70"
     data-fps="7"
     data-hd-film="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/695922967222730134/636x382_JPG-HD_695922967222730134.jpg"
     data-hd-frame-width="636"
     data-hd-frame-height="382"
     data-hd-frame-count="70"
     data-hd-fps="7" />
<noscript>
    <img src="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/695922967222730134/636x382_JPG-SINGLE_695922967222730134.jpg" width="636" height=382 />
</noscript>

  </a>
  <div class="articletext">
    <div >
     <p>
       
       Professional surfer Jamie O'Brien posted the stellar video to YouTube in April, showing him and his friends surfing down a storm drain in Hawaii. O'Brien stressed that the video was filmed prior to folks practicing social distancing for COVID-19.
     </p>
    </div>
  </div>

     data-followbutton="MailOnline"

                            <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-small">
  <meta itemprop="position" content="145" />
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a itemprop="url" href="/news/article-8289825/Terrifying-moment-three-construction-workers-seen-riding-violent-Nashville-storm.html">Terrifying moment construction worker falls from a three-story home's roof while his three screaming colleagues cling on for dear life during Nashville storm </a>
  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">
    <a href="/news/article-8289825/Terrifying-moment-three-construction-workers-seen-riding-violent-Nashville-storm.html">
          <img 
               src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/05/20/28042162-0-image-a-55_1588705802644.jpg"
               height="115" width="154" alt="" 
               style="max-width:100%" />
      
        <noscript>
      
          <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/05/20/28042162-0-image-a-55_1588705802644.jpg" height="115" width="154" alt="" />
      
        </noscript>
    </a>
    <p>
        
        Video shared by Tiffany Holt on Sunday shows the group of construction workers bracing for the intense storm in Nashville. Developers said that they workers are fine.
    </p>
  </div>

     data-followbutton="MailOnline"

                            <div itemscope itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement" class="article article-small">
  <meta itemprop="position" content="146" />
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a itemprop="url" href="/news/article-8293361/Baby-boy-born-Polish-village-TEN-YEARS.html">Baby becomes first boy to be born in Polish village for TEN YEARS after local mums only gave birth to girls for a decade</a>
  </h2>
  <div class="articletext">
    <a href="/news/article-8293361/Baby-boy-born-Polish-village-TEN-YEARS.html">
          <img 
               src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/18/28082882-0-image-a-16_1588786124353.jpg"
               height="115" width="154" alt="" 
               style="max-width:100%" />
      
        <noscript>
      
          <img  src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2020/05/06/18/28082882-0-image-a-16_1588786124353.jpg" height="115" width="154" alt="" />
      
        </noscript>
    </a>
    <p>
        
        Baby Bartek, pictured, is the first boy to be born in a small Polish villiage since 2010. His mother said he was a double miracle after also need a live-saving operation. The Mayor of the village is delighted.
    </p>
  </div>
  <div class="article-icon-links-container"
     data-followbutton="MailOnline"
     >
  <ul class="article-icon-links cleared">
    <li class="first">
  <a class="comments-link" href="https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-8293361/Baby-boy-born-Polish-village-TEN-YEARS.html#comments" rel="nofollow">
    <span class="icon"></span>
    <span class="linktext">
        <span class="readerCommentNo bold" rel="8293361">6</span> comments
    </span>
  </a>
</li>

    <li class=" gr3ox">
<a class="https://mol.im/a/8293361| js-sl share-link" data-social-drawer="true" data-url="https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-8293361/Baby-boy-born-Polish-village-TEN-YEARS.html" data-email-share-style="email_share_article-drawer" data-headline="Baby becomes first boy to be born in Polish village for TEN YEARS after local mums only gave birth to girls for a decade" data-article-image="/1s/2020/05/06/18/28082868-0-image-a-14_1588786119180.jpg" data-show-flipboard="true"  data-show-fbmessenger="true"   href="#">
    <span class="icon"></span>
    <span class="linktext">
      <span class="bold">1</span> share
    </span>
    <span class="social-headline">Baby becomes first boy to be born in Polish village for TEN YEARS</span>
</a>
</li>

  </ul>

                <div class="article article-tri-headline">
  <h2 class="linkro-darkred">
    <a href="/news/article-8292275/Heartwarming-moment-deaf-blind-woman-enjoys-boogie.html">Heartwarming moment deaf and blind woman enjoys her first boogie after sound engineer builds her a special vibrating dance floor</a>
  </h2>
  <a href="/news/article-8292275/Heartwarming-moment-deaf-blind-woman-enjoys-boogie.html">
    <img data-mol-fe-video-preview
     src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7"
     data-src="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/6084186772032801719/636x382_JPG-SINGLE_6084186772032801719.jpg"
     width="636"
     height=382
     data-video="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/6084186772032801719/636x382_MP4_6084186772032801719.mp4"
     data-film="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/6084186772032801719/308x174_JPG_6084186772032801719.jpg"
     data-frame-width="308"
     data-frame-height="184"
     data-frame-count="68"
     data-fps="7"
     data-hd-film="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/6084186772032801719/636x382_JPG-HD_6084186772032801719.jpg"
     data-hd-frame-width="636"
     data-hd-frame-height="382"
     data-hd-frame-count="68"
     data-hd-fps="7" />
<noscript>
    <img src="https://video.dailymail.co.uk/preview/mol/2020/05/06/6084186772032801719/636x382_JPG-SINGLE_6084186772032801719.jpg" width="636" height=382 />
</noscript>

  </a>
  <div class="articletext">
    <div >
     <p>
       
       Marilyn Dommett, 62, from Southampton, lit up as she danced to the vibration from tracks by Snoop Dogg and Motley Crue in her garden. Joyous footage shows the mother-of-two smiling and shaking her hips. At one point, she also bends over to touch the vibrating dance floor. Simon Kilmister, 39, built the floor by placing a subwoofer speaker underneath a square piece of wood, allowing the user to feel the vibrations. Marilyn has been deaf her whole life and can only make out the difference between night and day, her family said.
     </p>
    </div>
  </div>
  <div class="article-icon-links-container"
     data-followbutton="MailOnline"
     >
  <ul class="article-icon-links cleared">
    <li class="first">

    <span class="icon"></span>
    <span class="linktext">
        <span class="readerCommentNo bold" rel="8292275">3</span> comments
    </span>
  </a>
</li>

    <li class="">

    <span class="icon"></span>
    <span class="linktext">
      <span class="bold">1</span> video
    </span>
  </a>
</li>

    <li class=" gr3ox">
<a class="https://mol.im/a/8292275| js-sl share-link" data-social-drawer="true" data-url="https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-8292275/Heartwarming-moment-deaf-blind-woman-enjoys-boogie.html" data-email-share-style="email_share_article-drawer" data-headline="Heartwarming moment deaf and blind woman enjoys her first boogie after sound engineer builds her a special vibrating dance floor" data-article-image="/1s/2020/05/06/12/28069546-0-image-a-38_1588765868350.jpg" data-show-flipboard="true"  data-show-fbmessenger="true"   href="#">
